name: NSPositionalSpecifier
desc: A specifier for an insertion point in a container relative to another object in the container.

items.name: init(position: NSPositionalSpecifier.InsertionPosition, objectSpecifier: NSScriptObjectSpecifier)
items.desc: Initializes a positional specifier with a given position relative to another given specifier.

items.name: var insertionContainer: Any?
items.desc: Returns the container in which the new or copied object or objects should be placed.

items.name: var insertionIndex: Int
items.desc: Returns an insertion index that indicates where the new or copied object or objects should be placed.

items.name: var insertionKey: String?
items.desc: Returns the key that identifies the relationship into which the new or copied object or objects should be inserted.

items.name: var insertionReplaces: Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether evaluation has been successful and the object to be inserted should actually replace the keyed, indexed object in the insertion container.

items.name: var objectSpecifier: NSScriptObjectSpecifier
items.desc: Returns the object specifier specified at initialization time.

items.name: var position: NSPositionalSpecifier.InsertionPosition
items.desc: Returns the insertion position specified at initialization time.

items.name: func setInsertionClassDescription(NSScriptClassDescription)
items.desc: Sets the class description for the object or objects to be inserted.

items.name: func evaluate()
items.desc: Causes the receiver to evaluate its position.

items.name: enum NSPositionalSpecifier.InsertionPosition
items.desc: The following constants are defined by NSPositionalSpecifier to specify an insertion position.
